titleStmt.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to J. C. Bancroft Davis, May 17, 1882

bibl.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to J. C. Bancroft Davis
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.persName: Davis, J. C. Bancroft (John Chandler Bancroft), 1822-1907

div1.p:
Residence No. 806 M street N.W.
Washington, D.C., May 17, 1882.
I have the honor to enclose herewith my bond executed, the blank form of which was forwarded me in your despatch No. 33, dated May 10th, 1882.
The sureties are Hon's B. K. Bruce, U.S. Register and Samuel F. Philips, U.S. Solicitor General.
I have the honor to inform you that I was born in the city of Richmond–state of Virginia–in the year 1844, and that I am a resident of Wilmington, N.C., and a citizen of said state.

With sentiments of highest consideration, I am, Sir,
Your obd't serv't,
Jno. H. Smyth
div1.fw:
Hon. J. C. Bancroft Davis,
Assistant Secretary,
Washington, D.C.
